com.smartnsoft.droid4me.util
Class BitmapToolbox

java.lang.Object
  com.smartnsoft.droid4me.util.BitmapToolbox

public final class BitmapToolbox
extends java.lang.Object

A toolbox of Bitmap functions, that handle bitmap transformations.

Since:
2010.02.27
Author:
Édouard Mercier

Method Detail

turnToGrayScale

public static android.graphics.Bitmap turnToGrayScale(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
Returns:
the bitmap itself, but turned into a gray-scale

flipBitmap

public static android.graphics.Bitmap flipBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                                 boolean horizontal)
Flips the provided bitmap horizontally or vertically.

Warning, the original bitmap is recycled and cannot be used after this call!

Parameters:
bitmap - the bitmap to flip
horizontal - indicates the flip direction
Returns:
the transformed bitmap

mergeBitmaps

public static android.graphics.Bitmap mergeBitmaps(android.graphics.Bitmap bigBitmap,
                                                   android.graphics.Bitmap littleBitmap,
                                                   int left,
                                                   int top)
Merges a little bitmap to a larger one.

Warning, the original bitmaps are recycled and cannot be used after this call!

Parameters:
bigBitmap - this object is recycled once the method has returned
littleBitmap - this object is recycled once the method has returned
left - the left of the top-left corner position on the big bitmap where to place the little bitmap
left - the top of the top-left corner position on the big bitmap where to place the little bitmap
Returns:
a bitmap which is a merge of the two bitmaps

computeReflectedBitmap

public static android.graphics.Bitmap computeReflectedBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                                             float reflectionRatio,
                                                             int reflectionGap,
                                                             int startGradientColor,
                                                             int endGradientColor)
Computes a new bitmap with a reflect at the bottom.

Warning, the original bitmap is recycled and cannot be used after this call!

Parameters:
bitmap - the bitmap used for the reflection
reflectionRatio - the percentage of the input bitmap height (between 0 and 1) which indicates the height of the reflect
reflectionGap - the number of pixels that should separate the bitmap and its reflect
startGradientColor - the color (with an alpha properly set), which is used to start the reflection gradient
endGradientColor - the color (with an alpha properly set), which is used to end the reflection gradient; a typical value is 0x00ffffff
Returns:
a new bitmap, which contains the reflect

enlarge

public static android.graphics.Bitmap enlarge(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                              int width,
                                              int height)
Resizes a bitmap so that it is filled with transparency in order to match the expected dimension. No scaling is performed.

Warning, the original bitmap is recycled and cannot be used after this call; futhermore, it is supposed that the provided image is smaller in both dimension that the provided dimensions!

Parameters:
bitmap - the bitmap to enlarge
width - the new width of the image, which much be greater or equal than the provided bitmap width
height - the new height of the image, which much be greater or equal than the provided bitmap height
Returns:
the resized image
